posts.cooked:
For 14th January 2022:
Signal is #3 in Germany: Google Play Ranking: Top Free Communication Apps in Germany

#2 in Austria: Google Play Ranking: Top Free Communication Apps in Austria

Edit: #2 in Germany now

Signal should post on Twitter to celebrate 100 million downloads today 3 March 2022.
50 million milestone was achieved around 14 January 2021:
https://twitter.com/signalapp/status/1349577579091566592
From this: https://twitter.com/DasLPSchaf/status/1499368081772228608

posts.name: Ponytail
posts.cooked: I don’t think they should celebrate, the reason Signal gained new users is because of a war.

posts.name: Jeremy
posts.cooked: I think the idea is that it’s great that so many people moved to something more secure for their safety.

posts.name: Ponytail
posts.cooked:
But this does not change the fact that the increase of new users is because of an armed conflict, where people are dying everyday.
There is a direct correlation between the conflict and Signal gaining new users.

It won’t be a good PR move for Signal to say “yay! We are 100 million strong”, when at the back of our head we all know majority of new users are from Ukraine.

I think there is a correlation, but not necessarily the causation that is being read into it.

The war happening is not a positive thing for anyone. I would argue that the war didn’t cause anyone to move to Signal, however. The war caused people who would otherwise be less concerned with their digital security and privacy to now prioritize it. In so doing, those people found Signal to meet their needs.

I read Signal as being happy they are able to provide a service to people who now desperately need it, irrespective of the cause of that need being detestable.

posts.name: Ponytail
posts.cooked: That’s a good perspective.

posts.name: Jeremy
posts.cooked: You nailed it @Turtle . Really well-said.

Screenshot_20220320-1104241080×2130 294 KB

posts.name: anon53652

I’m guessing it’s daily new installs?

Signal has moved +3 to #17 in Turkey today!
